website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a smart feeder that falls on the lower end of the price range, this model has been updated and has some nice features – but it also has some app and setup issues.
pros: Offers similar features as other models for a lower price – fairly large hopper, portion control, and connectivity with iPhone or Android devices
Feeding tray is easy to remove and clean
cons: Difficult to set up, and app has bugs and could be more user-friendly

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.  Trying again with replacement
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening I noticed that the pull out tray was very loose and wobbly. It doesnt secure the bowl and also there were wires exposed underneath it. Not only did the bowl rock back and forth when attached, there was also a sizable gap between the feeder and bowl where food could get trapped in. Maybe this is a result of was damage during shipping? I really liked the first generation-which was built pretty solid and there was no issue with loose parts or exposed wires. So far tho pretty disappointed with quality at this price. I will not be replacing or ordering again from this brand
customer_reviews.author: Peach

customer_reviews.title: Company went under
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! The company went out of business and this feeder will not work. The app is no longer in the App Store. Below is information on the company as of April 2020. -We have furloughed 100% of our remaining staff -We have ceased all future product development, including bug fixes -We have turned off all non-infrastructure related expenses -We have terminated our office lease and are working remotely -We have applied for all available CARES stimulus funding
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lady

customer_reviews.title: It’s with 0 stars... this product is horrible and inefficient.
customer_reviews.text: I STRONGLY RECOMMEND ANYONE INTERESTED IN BUYING A SMART FEEDER TO LOOK AWAY!!! This smart feeder is horrible. It does what it wants. You pet will go the whole day without food. It constantly disconnects from WiFi. The device is always offline. This item is no good and very expensive. Trust me look elsewhere for a smart feeder. You will be just as angry as me. I wish I could get my money back !
customer_reviews.author: Naadir

customer_reviews.title: Totally unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews before buying this feed. I assumed all of the network issues reported in one-star reviews were due to poor WiFi setups. Nope. My WiFi is solid and I have Petnet connected to a dedicated 2.4Ghz access point, but it still intermittently disconnects. Sometimes it's because their servers are down, other times because the device just decides to disconnect. Either way I cannot trust the wellness of my pet with this device. Back it goes. What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Longo

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but now extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed with this product at first and it made me happy to know if we were running late from work that my dog would still get fed. But now this morning I woke up at 5:00am to my dog getting more than 4 breakfasts because if she smacks it hard enough and also tilts it, the dispenser will dispense food. I’m unhappy it’s thats easy for it to release food if she smacks it enough times with her paws. We have a camera and I went back and she’s been doing this the past few days so now the feeder is useless and we lost out on $200. I’m very disappointed and upset. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peter DiFranco

customer_reviews.title: Was good but breaks after a month!
customer_reviews.text: It does jam occasionally but this has only happened twice so far. I wish there was a camera on it so I could see when my dog actually eats the food and if it jammed and no food came out then I would know rather thinking she ate it already. UPDATE: This feeder no longer works the way it is suppose to. Food gets shot everywhere and barely makes it into the bowl, I have to remove the bowl everytime it feeds my dog just so she can find all the food as it goes under the bowl, gets stuck in the tunnel if the feeder, etc. NOT WORTH THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Wait for the next generation one to fix wifi issues or come with a Ethernet port
customer_reviews.text: When the device is able to connect to your wifi and you're able to set up automatic feedings, this device gets 5 stars. However, when it disconnects and you have to use the cumbersome app to get it reconnected and it won't, then you're stuck with a use device. Hold off until they have version that doesn't have to be connect through 2.4ghz. Also don't buy if you have Google WiFi Mesh router.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: 2.0 is one step forward and two steps back
customer_reviews.text: I used a previous model of this product and it’s worked great. I upgraded to this model and it was a disappointing mess. Went back to the old model. The biggest problem with this new one is my cat can easily reach in the hole and get more food to drop out. She would keep reaching in and more and more would fall out. This one jams up too, I’ve never jammed the old one. Last complaint is the tray for the bowl is too flimsy and cheap. The new hopper is nice and I like the fact that food falls into the bowl rather than sliding into it but it just doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Masinter

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable. Unbelievably unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine about a year ago now. It functions sometimes but definitely doesnt give proper portion control. Also this morning the device disconnected itself from my wifi and it's refusing to reconnect. Customer support is now a voicemail machine, and completely unhelpful. I'm currently at work, thank God this didn't happen while I was away. I leave for weeks at a time and rely on this to actually keep my animals alive.
customer_reviews.author: Kcreich

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, no customer service available.
customer_reviews.text: If I could leave 0 stars I would. Product does not stay connected to internet, I have left a message a week ago for customer service to call me back, sent a email and no response. I had the 1st gen of this product and worked well and stayed connected for years with no problems. This experience has completely changed my view on this company.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our 1st generation Petnet feeder (which we loved) with this 2nd generation version. We like this one even more! 1. Easier to set up. 2. Easier to fill with food. 3. Feed mechanism seems more reliable. The 1st gen had a rubber flap wheel that fed food and when I replaced the old feeder, I noticed the rubber flaps were getting deformed and cracked. This new feeder looks to have a hard feed mechanism. 4. Food dumps out above the bowl instead of from the end of the bowl, so it ends up right where the cat wants it.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere.....
customer_reviews.text: As much as we’ve tried to give it a chance, we stopped using it within 6months. There’s much design flaws. (1)Biggest one is the dish. Our cats are pretty bratty. And if their food is not dispensing, they will attempt. We ended up duck taping it on each side, so it won’t move. (2)It looses connection to the cloud. (3)And the food dispensing amount is unpredictable.
customer_reviews.author: Anna & Adam

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Needs to Remove This Item
customer_reviews.text: The company that made this product is not answering any customer service emails and seems that they may have folded sighting COVID-19 as their reasoning. A poor excuse in my opinion. As a result, Amazon should do it's customers a service and remove this product from the site so that no one else purchases it. You can't even get it to auto dispense food anymore since their entire device needed to phone home for such a basic feature... DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Angela Tatis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t able to connect to WiFi. Did trouble shooting with customer service and they recommended changing my WiFi network name— which would have a large impact on resetting all my home devices. I have an iPhone 8 Plus with the latest OS. I was told that this does not work on 5G networks, I tried it on a 2.4g and it still would not connect. There is no manual function on the device to use this without the app. So unfortunately, it doesn’t work at all for me.
customer_reviews.author: photog

customer_reviews.title: Expensive pet starver!
customer_reviews.text: Man oh man. Where do I begin? Do not order this thing unless you want your pet to starve while you are on vacation. It spits food everywhere because it throws the food out fast and not all of it hits the bowl. Their servers are constantly down and it misses pet feedings constantly. I sent it back after it missed 2 feedings in one weekend. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B

customer_reviews.title: Company is Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I typically don't write bad reviews. But after months of service interruptions and excuses on why the service is down, they are now blaming Covid on the issue and are going belly up. They are also trying to steal Covid relief funds from companies that deserve it. This product no longer works as promised, you can't control the quantity of food, frequency or even set simple timers anymore. Worthless product and I wish I could get my money back. It's a shame because years ago I had version 1 of this product and it worked great. Steer clear of this one. There is a reason it is so heavily discounted now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mosqueda

customer_reviews.title: Company, Support, and Ability To Set Up Gone
customer_reviews.text: Petnet appears to have basically ceased operating, including the ability to use the app to control the feeder. They asked existing customers to pay $4 month to keep up the service which didn’t happen. YOU CAN LONGER CONNECT TO THE FEEDER TO SET IT UP. I liked the product, even though they weren’t the most dependable. At this point though it appears it’s game over for Petnet so look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Doh

customer_reviews.title: Company Server Down
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this feeder when it first came out. It did everything I needed it to do and worked great. However, the server has been down for months and they are not addressing the issue. So if you buy this you will not be able to set up and program your feeder. It's essentially useless. I usually like to schedule extra feeds when I go out of town to supplement the wet food I'm not there to feed my cat, but I can no longer do that, nor make sure my cat is actually being fed. So I'd say search elsewhere for your automatic feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Bowling

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: honestly, very disappointed. I had the original PetNet and it worked great for a couple years. It died just a couple weeks ago and decided to order a new one. This is my second one I've used and both have had massive issues staying connected to wifi. Also, the portions are completely inaccurate - sometimes it pours correctly and other times, the bowl overflows with food due to it's erratic behavior. More times than not, I see a red light on the feeder button meaning it's disconnected from the web again....PetNet support is nowhere to be found either. I've tried calling multiple times with no response.
customer_reviews.author: Dawoud Kazimee

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be Defective and No Support
customer_reviews.text: I can't get them to return my calls or respond to my emails. I bought this feeder because the last one quit working and I could get no product support. Thought that if I bought a new one....silly me. I've owned this new model for a total of 3 months and it has ceased to power on. I have an electric water bowl tied into the same power strip and it's working fine. Doubt they'll reach out to me but if they do i'll update this review. Sorry the picture is sideways, but notice it's plugged in but has no power :-(
customer_reviews.author: Al Stickland

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product was buggy it never stayed connected to my wifi. And I would have to deactivate my entire account reset my wifi turn my phone on and off it was a frustrating pain. I went through three of these the old one and two new ones with the same problem. I did like the food proportions that was accurate the app was fully customizable. But it was over all could have been made better it's a little flimsy and the bottom of the tray is heled together by two pieces of wire. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: A. H.

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these PetNet feeders in March 2020. Shortly after, the company had problems with their server which is required to make the device work since it connects to their app. The feeders NEVER worked because there’s no manual option to use them not on their network. The company tried to roll out a “subscription service” of $30 a year to use the feeder, which many people paid, but they took peoples money and ran. The PetNet company is now out of business and their feeders are useless paper weights. The app doesn’t work. Their website is down. Expect to see class action lawsuit against this company soon, I’m sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Machine broke in less than 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product when I originally purchased from Walmart. Worked great until a week or so ago in February 2020. The mechanism gets jammed. I ordered another one and it worked but would not link to my phone so I sent it back. The company has not called me back or emailed me back to help. I just want the machine to dispense food properly when full and not give me low food warnings or get jammed when it’s full.
customer_reviews.author: bosstrent2010

customer_reviews.title: 2 systems broken in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: The first gen broke after about 12 months so I went ahead and bought this one. The motor broke after about 20 feedings. I haven't heard a word back from the company. Buyer beware. Very disappointing customer service. Update they sent a new feeder out a month or two later and it worked for about 2 weeks. It's constantly jammed by food. The dispenser mechanism is crap
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY!! Petnet no longer works!!
customer_reviews.text: DONT BE SCAMMED! Petnet servers no longer work! You can not program this feeder. It is just a $70 paperweight now. You can still use the button to dispense the default amount of food, but the button only works sometimes and the portion sizes are all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: David Hein

customer_reviews.title: Zero customer support, unreliable product
customer_reviews.text: I travel for long periods, I bought this to feed my cat. I use the food they used to sell on automatic refill. The unit broke after about 8 months. They replaced it. Replacement broke after 3 months. I opened a follow-up ticket with support, over a week with no response (except automated reply confirming receipt of my message), opened a new ticket - no response, tweeted to their support alias, no response. I will be submitting a claim to the Better Business Bureau next. Complete fail in product reliability and worse, complete lack of customer service. Very disappointing.😔
customer_reviews.author: Twin Thompson

customer_reviews.title: PETNET is Dead?
customer_reviews.text: At least for now, it is gone, it looks like a failure to pay the bills or a major failure. After 6 days, its time to return this. Hopefully Amazon will stop selling it soon... Overall this worked well, the portions we not quite right vs actual, but I had a good 4 portion system going, and my cat was losing weight finally and slowly as I had hoped. With PETNET not answering phones, chats or email (bounces?), their single twitter communication about not resetting it was and is not much help.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron D. Hillier

customer_reviews.title: Terrible app
customer_reviews.text: The hardware looks decent. The first day, I got it connected to wifi and Alexa, and I was pretty happy. But starting last night, the app shows it's offline; however, it's connected to Alexa, and I can still feed my cat via Alexa. After playing for a while, I suspect the problem is on the app side not the feeder itself. However, I lost control of the feeder. Since I happened to have my feeding schedule disabled before this happened, now it's just sitting there confusing my cat. I login to their web site to see if there is anything I can do, but no, they don't provide an interface to set up a feed schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Li Lei

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Broken product! No support!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible company with bad engineering decisions. The entire device ran server side and they constantly had outages on their end which would stop the device from working completely. Now they have abandoned the product! Company seems out of business. It’s too bad. It was good when it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Zekers

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! NOT Reliable at all!!
customer_reviews.text: Have it little more than a year, 6 month ago started having problems with it, the portion of each meal is wrong every single time. No customer support at all! Left them more than 20 voicemails, no one is replying to email. Absolutely nightmare! Today it stopped working completely. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Roth

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I always have trouble connecting to Wi-Fi and manually feeding my cat. Whenever I've tried to email customer support, I never get a reply. Good luck calling their "customer support" number, line goes dead immediately. The whole point of me purchasing this was to ensure my cat was fed when I'm at work. Thank God it still feeds him the preset amount that was programmed before all these connection issue. Things not cheap so I advise you to spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Schuyler

customer_reviews.title: Better than the first
customer_reviews.text: I had the first generation petnet. And the second generation is definitely an upgrade. The design is more compact with the hopper still fitting a 3lb bag of food. The dispense tray is my favorite as it no longer holds food in the dispense chute. So food doesn't get everywhere when taking out the food dish. The one hand top lid redesign makes it easier to load food. Overall they have definitely improved from then original.
customer_reviews.author: Irene L.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible app.
customer_reviews.text: The feeder randomly disconnects from the WiFi therefore not feeding my cats. It takes 15+ times for the app to try and locate the feeder despite putting in the correct Network Name and Password. App circles back and forth from "Assigned IP address from router..." to "Connected to local WiFi Network..." without ever getting past this point. I'm ashamed to say that I bought two of these devices and wish I hadn't.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Carrier

customer_reviews.title: Basically a very expensive food container that cannot dispense food with an app
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Countless efforts to connect to our WiFi, along with calls to the internet provider to reconfigure the WiFi to make the 2.4 ghz available and still not able to connect. Reached out to their non-existent customer service with phone calls, email, and multiple “Support Requests” with their third party customer service Tier One Success and still no response. Even simply pushing the manual dispense button on the feeder won’t spit out food. Don’t waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle G

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Support & Product
customer_reviews.text: So I had some issues with mine. I followed the instructions set it up properly and it wasn't feeding for some reason. I contacted support right from the app and they were able to see on their end that there was a possible issue with a gear that dispensed the food. So... They sent me a newer model. Assisted me with setting it up and now it works great. Fantastic support!! One thing I would recommend if you get this, is to check out the foods that they have listed. If you use one of those, it will add in all the nutritional facts about it automatically. You can also add your own with pictures and info too though.
customer_reviews.author: Will C

customer_reviews.title: Feeder is defective, 2/2 did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Completely non functional. I have now had two of these feeders stop working. The first stopped dispensing food even though it would at least try to, but the hopper didn't work. The replacement goes offline and doesn't feed our cats at all - without notifying us as it indicates it will. If I hadn't been checking regularly I would not have known it was defective. Incredibly unhappy with this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Major product malfunctions-  2 different units
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for 8 months and already had to contact the manufacturer for 2 major product malfunctions. The first (food jamming/non feeding even when it says it was dispensed) had quick response and they replaced the unit. It worked for a little under 6 months. Now there has been a system outage with no updates and no phone number/email for customer support. Way to risky for someone who relies on this technology for their pets. I will be going elsewhere for a new smart pet feeder.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Failed to work after 3 months and no customer service response!
customer_reviews.text: My original Petnet worked about 2 years before failing. I bought the newer white one to replace it in October 2019. It stopped working as of Jan 2020. Reached out to customer support via email and twitter since I do not have a phone number. Over a month later and still no response from either inquiry. Nice looking system with no customer service. Do not walk...run from this machine. No one seems to back it. Not worth playing Russian roulette for $100 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Rabin

customer_reviews.title: no longer works and no customer support from Petnet
customer_reviews.text: It appears the company Petnet has gone out of business. The smart feeder will not connect to their servers and therefore will not do any of the smart features advertised. I have had multiple of these devises over time thinking that the devise was defective when in actuality the company was not providing the services required to make the feeder work. I have called, left voicemail, Tweeted, and emailed the company time and again for months with absolutely zero response to any of it. do not buy this devise from Petnet it will not work to perform any of the advertised smart functions and will only dispense food manually by pressing the button.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R.

customer_reviews.title: No support.
customer_reviews.text: Everything you’ve read on the review page is correct. -The company will not respond if you need help. -Support articles are non existent. And the ones that are on their website are for set up only. -if you have ANY issues you will not get any help from the company. The feeder worked for maybe a few months and now it’s dead. Red LED light with no way to fix it. Lucky we were home when it died and not on vacation. Just...don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad buy!
customer_reviews.text: The only wonderful thing about this feature is that the cats can't open it and the can't tip it over. It does not weigh food, just gives what it thinks it should. As of August 2020 if you are looking at buying this device do not. It absolutely must have the app to work and their app is broken, and has been for over a month. If you buy this device now there will be no way to set it up and get it to start dispensing food.
customer_reviews.author: Chanteé

customer_reviews.title: Please don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Paid almost $130 for five months worth of use. The feeder suddenly stopped working, we tried everything. After multiple attempts to email, call, submit a ticket, no one bothered to respond.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding upgrade to an already outstanding product!
customer_reviews.text: We've had a SmartFeeder since it was in beta. We immediately loved the simplicity and effectiveness of it - however the 2nd gen has truly smoothed some sharp edges (literally and figuratively) and is wonderful to use. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Velure

customer_reviews.title: A $175 chunk of garbage
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have listened to the reviews. I thought maybe the bad reviews didn’t have the right WiFi or they were doing something wrong. Nope this this is just horrible. It stayed connected for like two days and now it keeps disconnecting. Worst part, of it disconnects, your pet does not get fed. It doesn’t even store the information in the feeding times. So no WiFi, no food. Don’t throw your money away.
customer_reviews.author: Brodie Green

customer_reviews.title: Device won’t stay connected to Petnet Servers
customer_reviews.text: Unit would not stay online with their servers. Redid setup a dozen times. Tested my WiFi and it’s fine. Something with servers on petnet end. Have seen multiple reviews with same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just gonna have to take a leap of faith that it won’t break. Should give it a try.
customer_reviews.text: I think the reviews a little biased. The unit isn’t complicated but not easy to connect the WiFi. At first it said it couldn’t find it. Then we waited til the following day for the server (on the other end) to receive and it works fine. For the price I paid and the fact that I can control remotely and use my Alexa I am glad I gave this a shot and gave it the old “benefit of the doubt. “ It’s pricey but it was worth it for the convinience
customer_reviews.author: Allie Cat

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t notify when empty, and then says it fed successfully, even though it’s empty!!
customer_reviews.text: So far it feeds, but other obvious functions aren’t working. It allows you to set how full the storage unit is, and it lowers that amount each time it feeds. Problem is, it didn’t notify when it was getting low, or empty, so unless you check it in the app constantly, you assume it has food in it still. So when it reaches 0%, it still tries to feed, and even says its succeeded, although it’s completely empty. Seems like a pretty obvious issue that should happen!!! Not happy with that, otherwise it’s worked as advertised in the 2 weeks I’ve had it.
customer_reviews.author: SethE

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I’m obsessed! Not only do I love the fact I have the ability to feed my pet the perfect portion at the same time everyday, I also love that it keeps the food protected/covered so it’s not just sitting out. My dog knows exactly what time his food is getting dispensed now and it’s so cute to see how excited he gets waiting for it! This has definitely been a game changer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Camille C

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY PETNET FEEDER
customer_reviews.text: I bought in July 2019. It had a one-year warranty. I did not install until October 2019. The portions were high. I. JNuary it stopped dispensing. I have a cat with diabetes that needs regular feedings. I sent an email to point out problems. They said they would get back to me ASAP. I tried to send more info on my troubleshooting. The emails did not go through. I called the phone number on their email and it was disconnected. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom's WIfe

customer_reviews.title: Has been OFFLINE for over 5 days.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. There is not a manual button to schedule a feed. If the feeder goes offline you will have no way off feeding your pet, unless you have a scheduled feed. I go between wet and dry food, and regularly need to turn my feeder on/off. The feeder regularly goes offline for hours, and the most recent has been aleast 5 days! Petnet uses a 3rd party server, and has not provided regular updates. As of now the machine is obsolete. Most importantly, you can not trust the device to work when you are away. Buy anything else!
customer_reviews.author: David Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Some Serious Flaws
customer_reviews.text: I love the variation in portion size and it seems to dispense the exact amount of food you set. The down fall is I have only gotten it to connect to my phone and wifi 1 time. It constantly gives errors. The manual feed button is the only way to feed my cat so not really an "auto feeder". The manual feed button is also a pain. I have to push it multiple times to get it to dispense the food. I really wish it worked liked it was suppose to.. it's a $150 cat dish at this point since it does not actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Sailorette

customer_reviews.title: Wow...AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter did her research and she absolutely loves this feeder. She was looking for automatic feeder for her dog because she has had cerebral palsy and doesn’t have good control of her hands. She has been given an opportunity to be able to feed her dog on her own. She likes the portion size to regulate and she can control just by a click of a button on her iPhone I would definitely recommend this automatic feeder!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: A disappointing bust!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these and was so excited to use it and I really liked the app and third party services but as I tried to set it up, I quickly became very disappointed. It wouldn't connect to the wifi. I tried to call tech support and a message automatically came on saying there was no agent's at this time and to leave a message. I then proceeded to submit a problem ticket via email, no response. I'm very upset about this because I returned it right away and haven't been able to find another device that matched the features and services the petnet claimed to have.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Minson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The petnet servers are no longer working. Before COVID-19 it had connection issues, since COVID-19 it does not connect to severs or app. In my looking for my connection issues. I have found all other users having the same issues and new PETNET ownwers not even able to create new account in app. so this thing is useless. wish i could give it -Stars
customer_reviews.author: Michael Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It’s crap and pretty sure company is out of business
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this product!! I have a problem with it every year. Doesn’t connect or a part broken. I just tried to email support and got a return email does not exist. I tried to call support from the app and it wouldn’t work. I called the number manually and it’s just an answering service. This thing and the company is a piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this, stopped working after 2-3 months
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this for about 5 months now, and it only worked for 2-3 of them. They had a massive issue that affected all feeders to make them not work. Sent an email asking why it stopped working, and never got a response until weeks later when they did an email blast to every user. Alrighty, so it happens, we tried to move past that. Still won't dispense correctly. Sent another email asking for help, and have never heard back. Do not spend money on this, they will not help you when it breaks almost right away.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Peters

customer_reviews.title: Stop working
customer_reviews.text: I got this a few months ago, and all of a sudden, it stops connecting to the wi-fi. I try to reconnect several times, but nothing happens. The app is terrible, can't find a way to reset it. I try contacting customer service, but they are nonexistent.
customer_reviews.author: Ricci

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable at best, useless at worst
customer_reviews.text: This product is terrible. The app lacks key features like "if this then that" logic. It never have accurate portion sizes. But it stopped working altogether and won't even dispense a morsel of food. I tried contacting support two weeks ago and never received a response. It says a lot when a company doesn't back their own product. DO NOT RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE terrible company!
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this feeder! I had a 1st gen and loved it but it died after 2 years of use then purchased this new update version lasted 2 months. It was over feeding my cats then one day a red light came on and it quit working all together. Customer service is the WORST I tried contacting the company to complain and get a refund or new system because they have a warranty on them but they do not respond to emails and will not take phone calls. I am absolutely disgusted I paid all that money for literally garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Support
customer_reviews.text: My unit has been offline for several days, and I cannot reach anyone at Petnet support. I have opened a support ticket and requested information on how to factory reset my unit so I can attempt to re-add it to my account and Wi-Fi. That ticket has went unanswered. If you call their support 800 number, it goes to a voicemail and nobody has returned my calls. I have even attempted to reach some support via Twitter and Facebook, but it appears their social media departments are just as inept as their Support department...
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Jams often
customer_reviews.text: I liked when I was using kitten food. It was very small in size and seemed to dispense food. I did notice There wasn’t much consistency in the amount. A year later when I started to blend the kitten and adult food the feeder started to struggle. Jamming occasionally. Since the switch is now complete to full time adult food, the feeder is unable to dispense the food anymore. The food is less than 5/16” in diameter (within specifications of feeder). I emailed support to see if there was a fix (larger wheel or bigger motor) with zero response.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M Karfs

customer_reviews.title: Go With ANYTHING Else
customer_reviews.text: I bought it, waited to get it, got it, and found out the company went dark about a month ago and none of their devices work. What an absolute scam. It’s going to take 14 business days for me to get a return too. What an absolute joke. Do not waste your time or money. Customer service will not respond. Just check their twitter account. It’s a circus.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Had it connected for a while. Now after moving to my new apartment it has failed to reconnect and the app keeps freezing. I’ve restarted it over and over and redownloaded it multiple times. I’ve also restarted the feeder multiple times. Nothing works.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. I have been having to manually feed out of it for the past 4 months and now I have just thrown it away. Unreliable feedings, portion size, customer service, and downtime made me move on. Not sure what happened to this company, likely business took over the how as well at the what. Never should have listened to their excuses for the red light of death.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Rios

customer_reviews.title: It was ok, but no longer used
customer_reviews.text: We used this for a few months, but then the portion control was incorrect and my dog would not eat out of the metal dish. The app is easy to use and the idea of consistency for feeding times was a great notion. If you live in an area with ants, this will attract them and we had that issue. After a full infestation targeting the dog food in the feeder, it was disassembled and put away. Certainly not an issue with the feeder, but the food is not air right. So just a heads up for buying based on climate.
customer_reviews.author: Rani

customer_reviews.title: More robust and always ready for action
customer_reviews.text: A great pet feeder. I can feed the cats without them attributing it to me. I get notified when their food runs out. The only thing I wish was that I could have more than one feeder on the same account/app. Hopefully a future improvement. Our younger cat gets more food up on a shelf away from the elder cat, so two feeders and two apps are required.
customer_reviews.author: Ammy Woodbury

customer_reviews.title: Better device design, same app
customer_reviews.text: I have owned some of the earlier versions of this product. They have definitely improved the design. The hopper has a horizontally rotating measuring paddle. This seems to be more accurate as well as making it harder for my cat to tamper with it. I like how it is a singular bowl that the food falls into, rather than a bowl with a chute in one. I think this also distracts the cat from digging in the device as well. Setup is very easy, it just requires an Android or Apple device. The app seems very straightforward. I have had some issues when remotely feeding when not on the same network.
customer_reviews.author: Jason James Lackore

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!!! Save your money for a RELIABLE alternative!!!
customer_reviews.text: Products consistently has issues with its network and support. They no longer occupy their office building, I have laid off all their staff. They claim that it is a result of COVID-19, however their office has been up for lease for three months now. The dishonesty and lack of communication with this company is truly disheartening. Well I loved this machine when it works consistently, then asking me to pay for a subscription service just to keep their doors open does not flight with me. I have tried to return, but since it has been too long since I’ve purchased my feet or Amazon would not allow it. Save your money and buy something else!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Portion size large and system outage
customer_reviews.text: My cat has gained weight since switching to this feeder. What the feeder releases as "1/4 cup" really ends up being close to 1/3 cup. Also, the feeder hasn't been working at all for a week now because there is a system outage that has yet to be fixed. The company sent out an email saying it was aware of the issue, but it still hasn't been resolved. My other compaints are that when you schedule a feed, the feeder doesn't actually release it until two minutes after the fact, and the app itself loads excruciatingly slow.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply built components, nonexistent customer service
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for about a year, then it just stopped dispensing food - the motor stopped turning the dispensing mechanism. All attempts to contact customer service by email and phone have failed. They don’t respond to email or phone messages at all. Not a peep. Don’t waste your money with this company. They have a decent idea how to build an automatic pet feeder, but absolutely no idea how to treat people or run a business.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Rau

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF JUNK!! AVOID!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute JUNK!! I’ve had this thing for over a year. A weeks ago it started missing feedings and acting up. Now it’s just glowing red and is offline. Zero customer support. They tweeted out 4 days ago they are having service outages but no updates. It’s completely useless!! Do not buy!!! Don’t waste your money! Total piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Poor software and connectivity, useless after the second week of having it.
customer_reviews.text: It will disconnect itself from your network within two weeks, and if you turn it off, feed settings get erased, I have made several attempts to reconnect to the network and it won’t even do that, you have to manually enter your network name, which is a huge minus for me. Submitted a trouble ticket and nothing has been done, I have seen a major trend on their website that blocks out the “call customer service” buttons because I’m sure they’re tired of all the complaints consumers have with this product, I’m sending it back for a refund after I return from my business trip. The red light indicates that it is off the network.
customer_reviews.author: Veenix82

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waist your money! Zero stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: We got the device with high hopes that we can leave home and not have to worry about feeding our cat. We were completely wrong, setup wasn’t as easy as the instruction said, the portion that we specified on the app was never correct and would give too much food or too little. Tried calling support and they always seemed to have a high call volume and the wait was long. Don’t waist your money on this device. If I could give it zero stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool Product - Terrible Execution. Do Not Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: The feeder has great features and is a breeze to set up feeding. But this product has one flaw: it doesn’t work 50% of the time!! The feeder randomly goes offline, no rhyme or reason for it. And it’s not our WiFi...we have plenty of other items (Nest, etc) than never ever go offline in our house. Not only does it go offline which doesn’t allow you to give an extra feeding, but scheduled feedings just randomly won’t happen even when the bowl is completely empty. We were away and our cats didn’t have food for over a day until we were able to get home. We felt absolutely terrible and can’t risk it again with this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Previs

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
customer_reviews.text: This has only worked right a few times. The portion sizes are wrong, and it never consistently feeds your pets. Absolute junk. When you call support there are no agents available and emails to support do not get returned. Absolutely horrible product....I don't leave reviews often but please steer clear of this.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kinda good.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it, worked perfect. it isn't made for multiple animals. The tray at the bottom can be difficult to put back on or stay on. Now it doesn't work at all. It wont connect to WIFI no matter how close I am to the router. I would say I am not 100 percent satisfied. I called the company multiple times no response or call back.
customer_reviews.author: HannaElizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Don‘t buy...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say this, but there is a couple of server issues to connect this device since a few month. So it’s now a absolutely useless product without a connection to the petnet server. Now petnet asking for a monthly payment to have a better service and fixing the server issues.... sorry, but i don’t pay extra money monthly that i can (maybe) use this product. And you have to know, you can’t use this feeder with the app without the server connection....
customer_reviews.author: RealGerry

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: When will this issue be corrected? This is over 36 hours!!! This problem has caused a substantial inconvenience. I am extreme disappointed. I’m also buying a new unit that is reliable and better support and on your reviews I will indicate this through my feedback. This has cost me to reschedule feeding of my dog hiring people to feed him countless other issues that I have to contend with now because that feeder is in operable
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Spieler

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable. Don’t starve your pet.
customer_reviews.text: Avoid! System is totally unreliable. Feeder itself works well, but the system goes down sporadically, and has now been down for several days. I cannot trust this feeder to feed my pets, thus making it completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Ippolito

customer_reviews.title: Even an expert couldn’t get this to work
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is an automation engineer and he couldn’t get the feeder to work. It never dispensed the amount of food selected and never did it at the appointed time. Maybe mine was a lemon, but for the price, I expect it to work
customer_reviews.author: LBW0509

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a little more than a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a little more than a year, and then the plastic portion separators started breaking, causing it to jam. I contacted petnet and never got a response. I just wanted to know if it was possible to get replacement parts. Since they wouldn't respond, I threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Leddy

customer_reviews.title: DONT DO IT
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and go elsewhere. After constant “service disruption” emails from PetNet, my feeder lost connectivity entirely. I tried trouble shooting with no luck. I submitted a “help” ticket via their email and never received a response outside of “we have received your request”...super helpful. Over the two years that I had the feeder, it lost connectivity as often as it had it and missed several feedings for my cats. Complete trash and a company that can’t even maintain their backend infrastructure, let alone customer support, shouldn’t be getting your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Wont stay online to function
customer_reviews.text: This product is incredibly hard to set up, and loses the signal that it needs to keep it online and functioning. It's a worthless POC and I would not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: queeniekoly

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Works about 1 out of 10 times. Bought this with hopes of being able to leave for for a weekend here or there but unfortunately it is so unreliable. Biggest waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Allison T.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot connect multiple feeders per house
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a second cat so I bought a second feeder (previously bought an amazing petnet feeder for first cat). Unfortunately there has been a connectivity issue with this new feeder. I tried calling Petnet and waited on hold and then left a voicemail. Over a week ago, no call back. Not sure you can have two feeders on one WiFi network, didn’t even bother trying two feeders per phone. Disappointed with the quality of this model compared to the original, the connectivity issue, as well as the company for lack of response.
customer_reviews.author: nettie boh

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. Company went out of business and the app that operates it, doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Best feeder for your pets!
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade from version 1 and we love it. The food releases into the bowl nicely and doesn't get clogged. It's a little louder than the original but my cat hears it and goes running to the feeder. Easy set and I like that the unit is a little smaller. Oh and customer service is excellent, fast response.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive & a Very big Failure.
customer_reviews.text: Unit does not work APP cannot connect. Server errors. Poor Poor Poor. No customer service. Read similar reviews. Product needs complete redesign & hire outside server. I have a $3.00 bowl that works better. Returning item.
customer_reviews.author: Guy BOYD

customer_reviews.title: Useless item- company closed
customer_reviews.text: The Petnet company went under, and even thought the item works, there is no software to use. It will not function without software. It’s just an expensive food holder now. I’m super angry that I have no recourse. DO NOT BUY ONE.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: AVOID THIS PRODUCT - App and Cloud functionality frequently go offline
customer_reviews.text: Since earlier this year, the company appears to be going out of business and their device loses connection to their servers, sometimes for over a week at a time. Avoid this product as it could be out of business soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money. It stopped working after a month, with no response from customer service when I asked for help. The gears inside have stopped turning correctly. When I tried to reach out again, their support email bounced my message back.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Allport

customer_reviews.title: Awful Product
customer_reviews.text: My original purchase broke within 30 days and was replaced by Amazon not the manufacturer. The replacement won't connect to the wifi. I utilized the manufacturers instructions and was unable to get it back online. I attempted to email the company. The email provided online and in the manual is no longer working. Several calls with messages and all I hear are crickets. Company lacks quality and dependable customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Strang

customer_reviews.title: Broke after about a year of use
customer_reviews.text: 1. was difficult to sync with wifi 2. can't handle larger bits of kibble - I'm using wellness adult dry dog food, and it gets jammed 3. portions were measured accurately, and when it worked it worked well enough
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS FEEDER- THE COMPANY CLOSED!
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it zero stars but I can't actually do that. Do not fall for this feeder. This company closed, rendering these feeders useless since they can't connect to the company's servers/app. No wonder it was way cheaper. I received this and immediately tried to install the app and connect. The app doesn't even connect. When I did some digging up, this company closed supposedly due to covid, but it seems they had prior issues to that due to faulty products and software. Even their website is down. Returning this bulky piece of junk ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always shows offline
customer_reviews.text: Received product and then the next day their system went offline and it hasn’t worked since. It’s been a week. They have said it’s still feeding on time even if you can’t tell but when I’m out of the house I need to be reassured my cat it being fed on schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Overfeeds
customer_reviews.text: My dog was suddenly lethargic And was over pooping. I decided to spend a few days testing the machine and learned that while some feeding size were accurate, other times it would double or triple the food. Not sure about the newer models, but I would pass on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Astoria

customer_reviews.title: A HUGE improvement over the first generation
customer_reviews.text: Far far better than the first gen, the overall design, ease of use and simplicity are what make the 2.0 better than the original, they worked out a lot of the weird bugs and quirks that made the first machine a bit strange. Definitely recommend this pet feeder - its by far the best looking, and easiest to use once the set up is done. It's not perfect, PetNet still has a virtually nonexistent customer service, and their app belongs in 2011, but they've got me on board for the meantime.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Won't work
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get it to come up on my cell. I emailed Petnet and they said they were looking into it and would get back with me...didn't happen. I checked my cell and it now says (for 3 days) Down for Maintenance! I have sent another email today asking how long it can take! No answer. I had this brand for a few years and it worked fine until I moved and it wouldn't sync with my phone. I just assumed it quit working so I ordered a new model...don't think it's the unit, just think it's the company. I will give it two more days and then I am returning it...I'm disgusted with trying to get them to do something!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Land

customer_reviews.title: Company went out of business - DO NOT BUY, IT DOESN'T WORK
customer_reviews.text: The company that makes this feeder went under after COVID-19. You need their servers to make the device work and they are down for good. Do NOT buy this. I do not understand why Amazon hasn't pulled this item from being sold as it no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Vega

customer_reviews.title: Returning, Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I had no trouble connecting to the 2.4G internet but within a day it lost connection and missed 2 feedings. The manual feed button doesn't distribute accurate amounts with round medium kibble and malfunctions requiring multiple manual feed button presses. Two missed feedings in one day is too many to trust for my furbabies while working 14 hour shifts. Looking for a replacement since the FeedAndGo company went belly-up bringing the costly feeder to a standstill without the app, this wasn't worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Petnet SmartFeeder (2nd generation) - Automatic Wi-Fi Pet Feeder with Personalized Portions for Cats and Dogs - App for Android, iOS and Works with Amazon Alexa
product_meta.description: Color:1-WhiteThe Petnet smart feeder is a Wi-Fi connected automatic pet feeder for individual cats and dogs, up to 60lbs. Using the Petnet app you can personalize your pet’s daily meal times and portions, order pet food for delivery – and even Feed Fido from your phone! Comes with a 1-Year limited warranty and Customer service For the life of the product.
feature_bullets: SMARTPHONE CONTROLLED: Control your pet’s daily feeding times anytime, anywhere – using your iOS or Android smartphone. Requires a wireless router 2.4GHz (802.11b/g/n)
PERSONALIZED MEAL PORTIONS: Use the Petnet App to tell us about your pets breed, age, weight and activity level and we’ll recommend personalized meal portions.
RECEIVE ALERTS: Get notified when your pets been fed
EASY TO CLEAN: Pet-Proof Self Locking Lid, Food Container, Food Container Lock, Food Dishwasher Safe Metal Bowl, Durable Portion Wheel.
POWER: Built-in rechargeable backup battery, up to 2 days of battery life.
PET WEIGHT: Not recommended for pets over 60 pounds.
MULTI PET: Not recommended for multiple pets. Designed to support one pet per feeder.

PET FOOD DELIVERY: Purchase includes FREE trial of Petnet SmartDelivery – Get your pet’s food delivered in the freshest bag size, based on how much they should eat each day. (Not all foods available. Currently shipping over 2,500 bag sizes and recipes.)

MORE INFORMATION: Comes with 1-year limited warranty. Petnet's US-based Customer Support will be glad to help,call, email or chat Monday through Saturday. Petnet has been an industry leading pet product company focused on healthy feeding since 2015, helping pet owners all over the world.

WORKS WITH: Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant and Nest Cam so you can use voice commands to dispense food, get updates about when your pet was last fed, find out how much food is left, and even view snapshots of your pet eating.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
